## ðŸ”’ Freedom Is Not Convenience â€” It Is the Ability to Leave

Convenience is often mistaken for freedom in digital systems. This article dismantles that confusion, arguing that freedom is not how easy a system is to use â€” but how little it costs to exit. True freedom appears only when leaving does not destroy what youâ€™ve built.

tags: ðŸ”’ Freedom Is Not Convenience â€” It Is the Ability to Leave

Convenience is often mistaken for freedom in digital systems. This article dismantles that confusion, arguing that freedom is not how easy a system is to use â€” but how little it costs to exit. True freedom appears only when leaving does not destroy what youâ€™ve built.
